title: Wait, Walmart Is So Good Right Now—23 Elevated Black Friday Sale Picks That Caught My Eye
description: See the chic and affordable deals.
excerpt: The Best Walmart Fashion Deals to Shop for Black Friday 2024
text: The Walmart fashion section is so good right now, so I couldn't help but head over to the site to check out the Black Friday deals. Sure enough, I found a selection of elevated everyday pieces including cool jeans as well as an array of trendier options that are perfect for fall and winter.Some of the finds that caught my eye were the effortless outerwear, chic sweaters and polished dresses. The shoes were also major standouts and pair well with just about every option included in my roundup below. Keep scrolling to shop 23 Walmart finds that are not only elevated but most come in under $50. Camel coats are always a good idea. Scoop Rhinestone Mesh Ballet Flats Free Assembly Cardigan Sweater With Chest Pockets The It denim style right now. Time and Tru Penny Loafers Timeless loafers that go with everything. Jessica Simpson Farrah Pullover Sweater 'Tis the season for this sweater style. Scoop Ultimate Crepe Slouchy Double Breasted Blazer This instantly elevates any look. Free Assembly Ruffle Neck Cotton Embroidered Midi Dress A polished black dress pick. Dolce Vita Panna 50/50 Over the Knee Boot I'd wear these with leggings and an oversize sweater. Outfmvch Oversized Half Zip Pullover Sweater Casual, cool, and comfortable. Dorothy Perkins Dorothy Perkins Womens Military Plus Coat How is this under $100 right now? Madden Girl Valeriee Slingback Kitten Heel Slingback heels help make any outfit look more expensive. Free Assembly Boatneck Tee With Long Sleeves Boatneck tops are a personal favorite. Dreamers by Debut Cowl Neck Sweater Sofia Jeans by Sofia Vergara Eden Slim Straight Super High Rise Jeans One of my favorite denim styles. No Boundaries Cozy Lug Sole Ankle Boots These go with everything from jeans to leggings. Fantaslook Oversized Crewneck Sweater I could live in this sweater. Nine.Eight V-Neck Satin Midi Dress With Long Sleeves Chic-little-black-dress alert. Journee Collection Charra Faux Leather Square Toe Strappy Sandals In case you have a warm-weather vacation on the horizon. Time and Tru High Rise Corduroy Wide Leg Pants A definite closet staple. Neutral blazers always come in handy. Madden NYC Kitten Heel Slingback Shoes Another cute slingback option. Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
html:
The Walmart fashion section is so good right now, so I couldn't help but head over to the site to check out the Black Friday deals. Sure enough, I found a selection of elevated everyday pieces including cool jeans as well as an array of trendier options that are perfect for fall and winter.

Some of the finds that caught my eye were the effortless outerwear, chic sweaters and polished dresses. The shoes were also major standouts and pair well with just about every option included in my roundup below. Keep scrolling to shop 23 Walmart finds that are not only elevated but most come in under $50.

Camel coats are always a good idea.

Scoop

Rhinestone Mesh Ballet Flats

Free Assembly

Cardigan Sweater With Chest Pockets

The It denim style right now.

Timeless loafers that go with everything.

Farrah Pullover Sweater

'Tis the season for this sweater style.

This instantly elevates any look.

Chic-little-black-dress alert.

In case you have a warm-weather vacation on the horizon.

High Rise Corduroy Wide Leg Pants

A definite closet staple.

Neutral blazers always come in handy.

Madden NYC

Kitten Heel Slingback Shoes

Another cute slingback option.

Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
